content: Health Psychology Group now | 01/2024 University of Bamberg Research associate position investigating real-world dimensions of human behavior during (intense) heat. Using mobile in situ/EMA methods, the project's objectives are to better understand thermal stress protection for particularly vulnerable groups and to explore conditions under which health and well-being can be improved systematically in heat situations. Responsibilities include: Conceptualization and methodological development Statistical modeling, especially time-series analysis Development, technical implementation and administration of EMA/ESM infrastructure Data infrastructure Project Group for Computational Epidemiology 12/2023 05/2022 Robert Koch-Institute | Humboldt University Berlin Research assistant to the Corona Data Donation project with Prof. Dirk Brockmann's group for Computational Epidemiology. The project group is part of the Working Group Complex Biological Systems at the Institute for Theoretical Biology and at the IRI Life Sciences at the HU Berlin. Affiliated at the intersection of data analysis and outreach communications related to the Corona-Datenspende project. Responsibilities included: Data analysis and (interactive) visualization Frontend development Psychology and Infectious Diseases Lab: COSMO study group 11/2022 11/2021 University of Erfurt Research on the link between human behavior and the spread of infectious diseases with Prof. Cornelia Betschâ€˜s working group. Part of the COVID-19 Snapshot Monitoring (COSMO) team. survey research: programming of standardized questionnaires, development of survey items and experiments use of inferential methods for statistical analysis of trend and experimental data %>% visualization (R) project management tasks, e.g. coordination with associated research institutions and co-researchers, publication of research data in accordance with the group's Open Science policy The PIDI Lab works on understanding principles of health behavior by applying a judgement, decision making and strategic interaction perspective to infectious disease control - especially with regard to the vaccination decision and prudent use of antibiotics. Members are committed to Open Science.
